p: Diagnosis of the silicone pneumonitis is based on the clinical history of silicone implant or injection, the radiological pattern of subpleural infiltrates and peripherally distributed ground‐glass opacities (GGO) 6, 7, and tissues biopsy with histopathological features of alveolar haemorrhage 7 and non‐refractile vacuole‐like structure within the alveoli 1. Presence of alveolar macrophages with intracytoplasmic silicone inclusions in bronchoalveolar lavage sample is useful in facilitating a diagnosis 3.
